com.barrysheehan.www

Class TextSimplifierInteractable

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.barrysheehan.www.TextSimplifierInteractable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Interactable

    public class TextSimplifierInteractable
extends java.lang.Object
implements Interactable
    Prompts the user for input and uses a TextSimplifier object to simplify user input.

    Employs a while loop to show instructions to the user and capture keyboard input until user explicitly quits.

    Since:
    1.8
    See Also:
    Interactable

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Captures keyboard input, simplifies input text using TextSimplifier ts, and prints the result to screen.

        The user is prompted to enter text to be simplified using the keyboard. When the user presses Enter the text is simplified and the result is printed to the screen via the execute() command. A while loop ensures the process is repeated until the user explicitly quits.

        Specified by:
        start in interface Interactable

      • execute

        public void execute()
        Uses TextSimplifier ts to simplify text stored in instance variable text and prints result to the screen.

        Also informs the user that swapped words will appear in green and unswapped words will appear in red.

        Specified by:
        execute in interface Interactable
